itemDescription: British engineer, civil servant  and photographer in India

wikipedia_page.main: John Claude White (1 October 1853 – 1918)  was an engineer, photographer, author and civil servant in British India. From 1889 to 1908, White served as the Political Officer in Sikkim, then a British protectorate. As part of his remit, he also managed British India's relations with Tibet and Bhutan.
